website_summaries.verdict: A top quality travel bowl that's a best choice for large and extra large dogs.
pros: Consumers report that this bowl is extremely high quality and well designed
It stands out for having a non-tip, rugged design that doesn't leak as well as being very lightweight
cons: large size may not work for smaller breeds

customer_reviews.title: Good Dog Travel Bowl
customer_reviews.text: Great bowl when I go to the beach need to take along water for the pups. The bowl stays in place when all three dogs (larger breeds) are vying for a drink. My other travel bowl collapses to easily spilling (and wasting) the water that I carry for them. I like the Ruffwear bowl and two medium large dogs can drink at the same time (if I hold it). It is light weight and easy to carry in its folded position.
customer_reviews.author: S. CharmianTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Over Priced but Best portable pet Bowl I have seen or owned
customer_reviews.text: Very portable. I like that it has a rather large capacity and that its shape promotes stability and helps prevent spillage . It folds flat and fits anywhere. Its not flimsy either. Underneath it is a loop that you can put a carabiner through for alternative carry options.
customer_reviews.author: Rolex

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay!
customer_reviews.text: I will be honest, I love Ruffwear gear but this one isn't my fav. It has less to do with the actual bowl as a whole I guess and more to do with my dog using it. She always pushes it closed and dog food always gets stuck in it while I'm opening or closing it. It's just okay in my opinion. I almost wish it was thicker material or something so she wouldn't crush it as easily. I wouldn't mind having a harder time closing it if it meant she wouldn't. I throw it in her dog food travel bag but it's really not my fav.
customer_reviews.author: The Lovelace’s

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product, well built!
customer_reviews.text: Light-weight, large, collapsible and inspite of what it looks like, it holds water great. Has a small flat loop to hook your caribiner onto so that you can attach it to your dog's collar. I tried 3 other products before I settled on this. This is the one and this is love. It holds like 4 x 18oz bottles of water and is large, so perfect for big dogs or dogs with big noses. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: FriedGreenTomatoes

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, lightweight, attractive--albeit rather pricey
customer_reviews.text: This bowl is big and sturdy enough to water (or hold food for) a very large dog, but easily collapses down to nothing. There is a small cloth loop on the bottom to attach it to a small carabiner, but it isn't actually very practical. Not worth taking off a star since I keep it in a tote bag anyway. The worst part about it is that it's such an attractive dog bowl, if I accidentally leave it unattended, people will steal it (true story, this is my 2nd one).
customer_reviews.author: Sustain Community Acupuncture

customer_reviews.title: Collapsible bowl that resists spilling and splashing in a moving vehicle
customer_reviews.text: Our dog likes to drink water in our SUV while we drive. The fact that the opening of this bowl is more narrow than its base, helps it to resist splashing. I really like it. In fact, after forgetting one at a park, I bought a 2nd replacement. There are many collapsible dog bowls, but this is the only one that I've found with a shape that resists spillage as a result from splashing in a moving vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Nice collapsible water bowl for long dog walks
customer_reviews.text: Second one of these I've had of these. The first held up for three years of everyday warm weather walks. Holds up well, but the fabric does eventually wear through. Folds down compactly and stays out of the way if clipped to a belt or bag. If you carry a drinking bowl for your dog, this one is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: large opening, lightweight, great for hiking or camping.
customer_reviews.text: i love ruffwear and i love this product! we use it when we go hiking and camping. it's very lightweight and doesn't leak. the opening at the top is very wide and is great for big dogs. there's a small loop at the bottom when clasped you can put a caribeaner and clip it to the outside of a your pack. it holds 64oz of water (completely full to the brim).
customer_reviews.author: Zachary V

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: I took this bowl with us on our trip to the national forest and I don't regret this purchase. It's a bit narrow but easy to clean and collapses thin enough to easily pack away. I definitely recommend it to anyone not wanting to lug around their stainless steel or ceramic bowl around on trips.
customer_reviews.author: Venna

customer_reviews.title: Great ultralight dog bowl!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with hopes it would be sturdy enough to handle ample amounts of water or food at a time on our backpacking trip. This item did not disappoint! It was compact, very lightweight and stayed steady when filled with food/water. Love this bowl!
customer_reviews.author: firefly

customer_reviews.title: Love this bowl
customer_reviews.text: We needed a travel bowl for our two big dogs. Love this bowl. It collapses when you want but doesn't fall easily when the dogs are drinking. Stays stable and doesn't easily tip. Great product
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lightweight dog bowl
customer_reviews.text: Super product! Switched to this b/c I was tired of another brand's "waterproof" fabric bowl leaking after a short time on the ground. This one does not leak, stays fully open, collapses easily, and really light if you're backpacking w dogs.
customer_reviews.author: artistclare

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Super lightweight and compactable. Holds a lot of water and seems to minimize them sloshing while they drink.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Jackson

customer_reviews.title: The Best travel bowl
customer_reviews.text: My favorite bowl for traveling, hiking and dog parks. Clean, collapsible and stores very easily, taking up no space.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cabral

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t leak!
customer_reviews.text: Third travel bowl (collapsible). First we are happy with. No leaks, no seeping, and holds a good volume even for our 80 lb mobster. Woof!
customer_reviews.author: cellslawyer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bowl and use it for water for my pup. Excellent quality and very easy to stow away while hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for travel
customer_reviews.text: This dish works great! It collapses easily enough for travel but not when in use by dog. Worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Joni

customer_reviews.title: Great for on the go pups!
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot with my dogs, they are in several dog sports and are constantly on the go. I have two of these portable dishes and they are great, I use them for water. They are easy to clean and keep in their travel bag!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very light and compact
customer_reviews.text: Very compact and easy to use. Doesn’t drip when hanging on the pack like my previous folding bowl did. Another winner from Ruffware.
customer_reviews.author: Rock Shadow

customer_reviews.title: Ruffwear is the best
customer_reviews.text: Love Ruffwear products. Great for travel or even as a water bowl for the backyard. Easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle B.

customer_reviews.title: This is the best collapsible dog bowl we have found for our 90lb ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best collapsible dog bowl we have found for our 90lb GSD Staffy. A must have for the beach and hikes!
customer_reviews.author: michael d thompson

customer_reviews.title: They love it when traveling
customer_reviews.text: Gave my daughter this dog bowl for their new puppy. They love it when traveling, or hiking. Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: solong40

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a number of collapsible dog bowls and this is by far the best. Large capacity, collapses easily, very durable, easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Leigh H. Perkins Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great for anything from taking your pouch to a restaurant
customer_reviews.text: Very portable and durable! Great for anything from taking your pouch to a restaurant, up to an adventurous hike.
customer_reviews.author: malerroto

customer_reviews.title: I keep this bowl in my car - its great for travelling or just day trips to the leash ...
customer_reviews.text: I keep this bowl in my car - its great for travelling or just day trips to the leash free. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Chapter 8

customer_reviews.title: Finally a travel bowl my dog likes!
customer_reviews.text: My bill dog mix is very picky about where she drinks water from, I’ve had no success with metal or rubber bowls but thankfully from a recommendation on YouTube, I tried these bowls out for hiking/camping with my dog. Luckily she likes it! I love that you’re able to fold down the collapsible height to where you want and so far from 4 day trip, no leaks yet. I’m curious to see how long the waterproof fabric holds up, a bit hesitant but so far no problems
customer_reviews.author: Claire H.

customer_reviews.title: Great backcountry bowl
customer_reviews.text: This bowl collapses well and is totally waterproof. Great for backcountry adventures or traveling. We did an RV trip and brought this bowl and it was great for leaving water in because the inverse taper kept the water from spilling as we drove around Moab. I left the first one in a ski hut, probably enjoyed by many powder hounds to follow, so just bought a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: AKChester

customer_reviews.title: My dog didn’t really like it so I put it in a closet and ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bowl 3 years ago , used it a few times . My dog didn’t really like it so I put it in a closet and forgot about it ... fast forward to now ... I got it out and used it at work for my dog ...and it leaks at all the folds ...
customer_reviews.author: augiethedude

product_meta.title: RUFFWEAR, Bivy Bowl, Blue Spring
feature_bullets: MADE FOR ADVENTURE: This ultra-light bowl weighs only 2.96 ounces (84 grams) and is designed to collapse, making it highly portable and always ready to hit the trail.
REFUEL AND REHYDRATE: The Bivy Bowl holds up to 1.8 liters of water or food and has a stable shape and grip bottom, making it easy for your dog to fill up after a long day.
FOR MESSY EATERS: The single-wall, watertight construction is easy to clean. The integrated hang loop lets you clip it to a pack or hang to dry.
BUILT TO LAST: The welded fabric is durable and sure to last for many adventures to come.
STAYING OUT LATE: The Bivy Bowl features reflective trim for greater visibility in low light, letting you and your pup extend your adventures.
